quest.name: Longing for Home
journal:
 Quest Sync
Volusus will not be moved.

Volusus succeeds in persuading you and Galla to search the ruins for clues to his parents' whereabouts. Though he had initially intended to visit their family home, the streets above have become far too dangerous, so you agree to go in his stead.

※Please note that the difficulty of this quest has been synced to your current level.

Volusus's directions prove remarkably useful and you are soon able to locate his house, ruined though it may be. You join Galla in sifting through the rubble for anything that might lead you to the boy's parents.
You succeed in finding a letter addressed to Volusus among what remains of his house. Galla, who is also engaged in the search, will be eager to inspect this vital clue.

Upon viewing the letter, Galla deducts it was left here for Volusus by his parents in the event he returned to the house. However, a considerable amount of time has clearly passed since then, and the missing family members are nowhere to be seen.
Volusus is thrilled to discover there is a good chance his mother Vipsania is still alive. Though this is a step in the right direction, there is much to be done before the family is reunited.
objectives: Search Regio Urbanissima for clues as to Volusus's parents' whereabouts.

dialogue.name: GALLA
dialogue.text: He's safer here than outside, but it's clear he'd be better off coming with us. There must be some way to persuade him.

dialogue.name: VOLUSUS
dialogue.text: Please, help me find my parents! My mum's got red hair just like me, and my dad—

dialogue.name: GALLA
dialogue.text: Volusus─ You have to understand that there's little chance we'd find your parents even if we went looking for them.

dialogue.name: VOLUSUS
dialogue.text: I do understand! That's why I'm waiting here. They promised to meet me at the station.

dialogue.name: VOLUSUS
dialogue.text: I know it's too dangerous for me outside. But you two can fight, can't you?

dialogue.name: VOLUSUS
dialogue.text: So, please. Please don't give up on them like everyone else...

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: It won't hurt to look, will it?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: It's either this or drag him off kicking and screaming.

dialogue.name: GALLA
dialogue.text: I worry that we're only giving him false hope...but very well.

dialogue.name: GALLA
dialogue.text: After all, the least we can do is try.

dialogue.name: GALLA
dialogue.text: Thanks to my time in the Vigiles Urbani, I know the capital like the back of my hand.

dialogue.name: GALLA
dialogue.text: Between the two of us, we should be able to conduct a reasonably thorough search.

dialogue.name: VOLUSUS
dialogue.text: Thank you so much! I can't wait to see them again!

dialogue.name: GALLA
dialogue.text: Let's not get ahead of ourselves...

dialogue.name: GALLA
dialogue.text: This is exactly what I was afraid of... To the task at hand, then. Given the present state of the capital, tracing his parents' steps will be no easy feat.

dialogue.name: GALLA
dialogue.text: Volusus, do you know anything that might help us in our search?

dialogue.name: VOLUSUS
dialogue.text: Well, I was thinking about going back to my house...if it's still there.

dialogue.name: GALLA
dialogue.text: Where is that? Are there any landmarks nearby?

dialogue.name: VOLUSUS
dialogue.text: It's on the outskirts of town, to the south. Between the tavern and the bookshop.

dialogue.name: VOLUSUS
dialogue.text: Oh, and Dad always used to fly a huge imperial flag in front of our house. We were the only family that had one in our neighborhood.

dialogue.name: GALLA
dialogue.text: That should be enough to go on.

dialogue.name: GALLA
dialogue.text: All right. Let's get going.

dialogue.name: VOLUSUS
dialogue.text: They're alive─I know they are!

dialogue.name: GALLA
dialogue.text: Well, we're in the right area. Remember: he said it was between a tavern and a bookshop, and that they had a large imperial flag in front of the house.

dialogue.name: GALLA
dialogue.text: Let me know the moment you find anything that might be useful, no matter how insignificant it may seem. Now, let's start our search.

dialogue.name: GALLA
dialogue.text: We can only hope they left some clue as to their whereabouts. Without it...well, let's cross that bridge if we come to it.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You find a letter amidst the rubble. Though much of it has been rendered illegible, you can make out the words, “You are cordially invited to an evening of fine food and drink at Palatium Novum.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Try searching elsewhere for a clue to Volusus's parents' whereabouts, and show anything promising to Galla.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You find a leaflet amidst the rubble, apparently from a bookshop. “The War on Ilsabard now in stock! Don't miss this chance to own the masterpiece dedicated to Emperor Solus's achievements.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Try searching elsewhere for a clue to Volusus's parents' whereabouts, and show anything promising to Galla.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You find a letter amidst the rubble. It begins, “Dearest Volusus─I pray this message finds you well...”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Galla will be eager to inspect this potentially vital clue.

dialogue.name: GALLA
dialogue.text: Found something, have you? Let's have a look.

dialogue.name: GALLA
dialogue.text: It's addressed to Volusus! And from his parents, no less!

dialogue.name: GALLA
dialogue.text: And you said you found it nearby...

dialogue.name: GALLA
dialogue.text: It looks like someone's tried to clear away the rubble, but then thought better of it─the place is far too exposed. His parents must've come back to see if their boy had returned home, and then left him this letter.

dialogue.name: GALLA
dialogue.text: Judging by the condition of the paper, it's safe to assume some time has passed since their visit. We're unlikely to bump into them simply waiting here.

dialogue.name: GALLA
dialogue.text: I'll write a reply just in case they return, but for now let's head back to Volusus. Excellent work finding this!

dialogue.name: VOLUSUS
dialogue.text: Did you find anything?

dialogue.name: GALLA
dialogue.text: Why yes, we did! A letter addressed to you from your parents, in fact. This is sure to help in our search, I know it.

dialogue.name: VOLUSUS
dialogue.text: Can I see it?

dialogue.name: VOLUSUS
dialogue.text: Hmm. This is addressed to me, but this isn't Mum or Dad's handwriting...

dialogue.name: GALLA
dialogue.text: Don't give up so easily, Volusus! Here, let me read it for you.

dialogue.name: GALLA
dialogue.text:
“I am injured, but am in...
Do not worry about me. For now, you must stay out of danger.
Love,
Vipsania”
Unfortunately, it looks like the part detailing their location got wet at some stage. It's completely illegible.

dialogue.name: VOLUSUS
dialogue.text: Vipsania─that's Mum's name!

dialogue.name: GALLA
dialogue.text: Ah, so it is from her after all. There's a good chance she's still alive!

dialogue.name: VOLUSUS
dialogue.text: I knew it!

dialogue.name: GALLA
dialogue.text: We're one step closer to finding her!

dialogue.name: GALLA
dialogue.text: In all honesty, I'm amazed we found anything. Thank you for convincing me that the search was worthwhile.

dialogue.name: GALLA
dialogue.text: It's clear as day to me now why your comrades have nothing but praise for you.

dialogue.name: GALLA
dialogue.text: With you on the case, we'll find his mother in no time!
